name: Mistletoe Holiday Card
description:
Would it really be Christmas without smooches under the mistletoe? Letterpress printed from two hand-carved linoleum blocks that began as an original illustration, give your love a subtle hint with this beautiful card. 

- 4 ¼” x 5 ½” folded card is housed in a green A2 (4 ½” x 5 ¾”) envelope 
- printed on environmentally sound 100% recycled kraft paper
- printed from two hand-carved linoleum blocks and hand-set metal type 
- letterpress printed on our 1967 Asbern press 
- blank interior, with the Anise Press logo on the reverse 
- hand-mixed ink in festive green with a silver mistletoe berries
- blank interior

Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

(Copyright Anise Press 2013)

name: Fair Isle Snowflake Holiday Card
description: This iconic symbol of winter and the holiday season is recreated on paper in a lovely fair isle knit pattern. - 4 ¼” x 5 ½” folded card is housed in a matching A2 (4 ½” x 5 ¾”) envelope - printed on environmentally sound 100% cotton paper - letterpress printed on our 1967 Asbern press - blank interior, with the Anise Press logo on the reverse - hand-mixed ink in dark blue with a pale blue snowflake - blank interior Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality. (copyright Anise Press 2013)

name: Rockin' Santa card
description: This dapper Santa, a glint in his eye as he croons into a slim microphone, would be an appropriate greeting for any lover of seasonal cheer. I purchased the original zinc cut at a letterpress warehouse sale, and this is Santa’s first appearance in print since his original foray. The Santas are printed on environmentally merry 100% recycled paper, with matching recycled envelopes. The deep cranberry ink is a fine match for the warm off-white paper. Blank interior. An image of 3 ¼”x 3 ¾” has been printed onto a 4 ¼” x 5 ½” folded card, and housed in a red A2 (4 ½” x 5 ¾”) envelope. With rounded corners. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: Fair Isle Reindeer Holiday Card
description:
Is there anything that feels more like winter than a fair isle knit sweater with frolicking reindeer? Not to us, which is why we re-created this favorite knit favorite on paper.

- 4 ¼” x 5 ½” folded card is housed in a matching A2 (4 ½” x 5 ¾”) envelope 
- printed on environmentally sound 100% cotton paper 
- letterpress printed on our 1967 Asbern press 
- blank interior, with the Anise Press logo on the reverse 
- hand-mixed ink in festive green with a pale gray
- blank interior

Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

(copyright Anise Press 2013)

name: Seek Him (Wise Man) card
description: The image of the Magus on his camel and the typography of the caption were hand-cut from a linoblock. We printed the block, using golden-hour red ink, on our 1896 Old Style Chandler & Price letterpress. The cards are printed on 100% cotton Crane Lettra coverstock. This paper, designed specifically for letterpress printing, is paired with matching Lettra envelopes. Blank interior. The image appears on a 5"x7" folded card, and is housed in an A7 (5 1/4"x 7 1/4") envelope. The paper offers a wonderfully textured and appealingly tactile surface for printing. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality. (copyright Anise Press 2013)

name: Donkey Christmas Card
description: Our family loves the old French carol, "The Friendly Beasts", which tells the story of the animals who gave of themselves to assist in the birth of the Christ child. This card depicts the first of these animals, the donkey. The image of the donkey was hand-cut as a wood engraving, and was printed on our 1896 Old Style Chandler & Price letterpress. A dark terra cotta ink was chosen for the donkey, depicted in the verse as "shaggy and brown." Two lines of the carol have been hand-set using metal movable type and printed, in deeper brown, as a caption inside the card. The cards are printed on 100% cotton Crane Lettra coverstock. This paper, designed specifically for letterpress printing, is paired with matching Lettra envelopes. The 4"x6" image appears on a 5"x7" folded card, and is housed in an A7 (5 1/4"x 7 1/4") envelope. The luxurious tactile quality of the card is well matched by the velvety appearance of the printed image. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: You Are My Favorite -- Poster (Pink)
description: These posters follow the design of our most popular cards, enlarged to 11”x14”. Instead of printing the text from vintage wood type, we carved the pattern into a block and added a splash of color by painting each heart by hand in watercolors. The gray ink pairs with the pastel colors beautifully, creating a gentle and heartfelt statement suitable for placement in a bedroom or nursery. Look elsewhere on the page to find the four other color options: blue, coral, mint, and yellow. These posters are printed on environmentally friendly 100% cotton paper. SOLD UNFRAMED. Each is shipped flat, protected in a plastic sleeve. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: Celebration card -- Happy Day!
description: We designed this card with feelings of celebration in mind and feel it's perfect for birthdays, anniversaries and graduations! The bright colors, the field of stars (drawn and cut by hand from a relief block), and the irrepressible energy of the wood type combine to achieve a sense of shared celebration. We’re making this line of cards in various colors and with different captions, perfect for recognizing any notable moment or accomplishment. This card is printed on speckled off-white paper which is 100% recycled and environmentally friendly. Paired with recycled kraft envelopes. Available gray stars with vibrant yellow-orange lettering. Blank interior, with the Anise Press logo on the reverse. This 4 ¼” x 5 ½” folded card is housed in an A2 (4 ½” x 5 ¾”) envelope. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality. (copyright Anise Press 2013)

name: Fair Isle Reindeer Box Set of 6
description:
Is there anything that feels more like winter than a fair isle knit sweater with frolicking reindeer? Not to us, which is why we re-created this favorite knit favorite on paper. This listing is for a set of 6 cards with envelopes.

- 4 ¼” x 5 ½” folded cards are housed in green A2 (4 ½” x 5 ¾”) envelopes
- printed on environmentally sound 100% cotton paper 
- letterpress printed on our 1967 Asbern press 
- blank interior, with the Anise Press logo on the reverse 
- hand-mixed ink in festive green with a pale gray

Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

(copyright Anise Press 2013)

name: Rockin' Santa box set of 6
description:
This dapper Santa, a glint in his eye as he croons into a slim microphone, would be an appropriate greeting for any lover of seasonal cheer. 

The Santas are printed on environmentally merry 100% recycled paper, with matching red recycled envelopes. The deep cranberry ink is a fine match for the warm off-white paper. Blank interior. An image of 3 ¼”x 3 ¾” has been printed onto a 4 ¼” x 5 ½” folded card, and housed in an A2 (4 ½” x 5 ¾”) envelope. With rounded corners.

Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: Fair Isle Snowflake Box Set of 6
description:
This iconic symbol of winter and the holiday season is recreated on paper in a lovely Fair Isle knit pattern. This listing is for a box set of 6 cards.

- 4 ¼” x 5 ½” folded cards are housed in matching A2 (4 ½” x 5 ¾”) envelopes
- printed on environmentally sound 100% cotton paper 
- letterpress printed on our 1967 Asbern press 
- blank interior, with the Anise Press logo on the reverse 
- hand-mixed ink in dark blue with a pale blue snowflake

Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

(copyright Anise Press 2013)

name: Howdy! card
description:
We live in Texas and 'round these parts, you greet your friends and loved ones with an emphatic, "Howdy!". This card is the perfect way to say hello to those far away.

- 4 ¼” x 5 ½” folded card is housed in an A2 (4 ½” x 5 ¾”) recycled kraft envelope
- printed on environmentally sound 100% recycled paper
- letterpress printed on our 1967 Asbern press using vintage wood type
- blank interior, with the Anise Press logo on the reverse
- hand-mixed ink in warm maroon and pale gray

Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality. 

(Copyright Anise Press 2013)

name: You Are My Favorite -- Poster (coral)
description: These posters follow the design of our most popular cards, enlarged to 11”x14”. Instead of printing the text from vintage wood type, we carved the pattern into a block and added a splash of color by painting each heart by hand in watercolors. The gray ink pairs with the pastel colors beautifully, creating a gentle and heartfelt statement suitable for placement in a bedroom or nursery. Look elsewhere on the page to find the four other color options: pink, blue, mint, and yellow. These posters are printed on environmentally friendly 100% cotton paper. SOLD UNFRAMED. Each is shipped flat, protected in a plastic sleeve. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. name: A Reader Lives a Thousand Lives
description: This limited edition letterpress poster is one of four prints commissioned by Cushing Memorial Library & Archives for Deeper than Swords, an exhibition celebrating the work of George R. R. Martin. The poster was was printed by hand on an antique printing press and used hand-mixed inks, hand-set wood and metal type. The 14X18 poster is printed on a sturdy cover stock made from 100% recycled content. This poster is part of a limited edition set of 50 prints; your copy will be numbered on the back. The poster is sold unframed and will ship in a clear protective sleeve and a sturdy cardboard tube. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: Home Sweet Home (framed print)
description: This is the third print in our Home Series, highlighting quotations about the value of home by letterpress printing wood type compositions onto vintage wallpaper patterns. We’ve printed the poster using two wood typefaces and a script plate onto wallpaper samples. We have selected four patterns of wallpaper, which are visible in the photograph and the item options: floral, engraved, striped, and geometrical styles. Feel free to contact us for additional images of specific versions. Because the wallpaper is relatively limp, we offer the 8” x 10” print framed. Each style is offered in a limited edition of 15 prints. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: Suite of Four George R. R. Martin broadsides
description: This suite of limited edition letterpress posters is comprised of the four prints commissioned by Cushing Memorial Library & Archives for Deeper than Swords, an exhibition celebrating the work of George R. R. Martin. The posters were printed by hand on an antique printing press using hand-mixed inks and hand-set wood and metal type. The 14x18 posters, with printed area of roughly 13x17 inches, are printed on sturdy cover stock made from 100% recycled content. The posters are part of a limited edition set of 50 prints; your copies will be numbered on the back. The posters are sold unframed and will ship in a clear protective sleeve and a sturdy cardboard tube. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: Love Is Home (framed print)
description: Where we love is home. This simple line, taken from an Oliver Wendell Holmes poem, speaks volumes. This is the second print in our Home Series, highlighting quotations about the value of home by letterpress printing wood type compositions onto vintage wallpaper patterns. Perfect as a housewarming gift, to celebrate a couple or as a wedding present, or to provide color and sentiment to your own home. Printed using four wood typefaces onto wallpaper samples to provide that homestyle feel. We have selected four patterns of wallpaper, which are visible in the photograph and the item options: floral, engraved, striped, and geometrical styles. Feel free to contact us for additional images of specific versions. Because the wallpaper is relatively limp, we offer the 8” x 10” print framed. Each style is offered in a limited edition of 15 prints. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

The bright colors, the field of stars (drawn and cut by hand from a relief block), and the irrepressible energy of the wood type combine to achieve a sense of shared celebration. We’re making this line of cards in various colors and with different captions, perfect for recognizing any notable moment or accomplishment. This card is printed on speckled off-white paper which is 100% recycled and environmentally friendly. Paired with recycled kraft envelopes. Available in either pale blue stars with vibrant red-orange lettering, or in cotton-candy pink stars with dark olive type. Blank interior, with the Anise Press logo on the reverse. name: A Mind Needs Books
description: This limited edition letterpress poster is one of four prints commissioned by Cushing Memorial Library & Archives for Deeper than Swords, an exhibition celebrating the work of George R. R. Martin. The poster was was printed by hand on an antique printing press and used hand-mixed inks, hand-set wood and metal type. The 13"x17" poster (on a 14"x18" sheet) is printed on a sturdy cover stock made from 100% recycled content. This poster is part of a limited edition set of 60 prints; your copy will be numbered on the back. The poster is sold unframed and will ship in a clear protective sleeve and a sturdy cardboard tube. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: Valentine's Card – My Favorite
description: This card goes right for the heart – a boldly assertive statement in vintage wood type, warmed by the iconic symbol set into the text. This second production of our 2013 Valentine’s line offers a direct sentiment about how we each feel about the people we choose. This card is printed on environmentally sound 100% recycled paper, which we’ve paired with matching envelopes. The warm crimson and rich black inks provide a dynamic contrast against the warm off-white paper. Blank interior, with the Anise Press logo on the reverse. This 4 ¼” x 5 ½” folded card is housed in an A2 (4 ½” x 5 ¾”) envelope. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: Arya's Prayer
description: This limited edition letterpress poster is one of four prints commissioned by Cushing Memorial Library & Archives for Deeper than Swords, an exhibition celebrating the work of George R. R. Martin. This 13"x17" poster (on a 14"x18" sheet) was was printed by hand on an antique printing press, using a hand-carved block for the text. The paper is a sturdy cover stock made from 100% recycled content. This poster is part of a limited edition of 50 prints; your copy will be numbered on the back. The poster is sold unframed and will ship in a clear protective sleeve and a sturdy cardboard tube. With thanks to Jo Walton for suggesting the poster topic. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: Handyman card
description: Do you have men or boys in your life who love tools? So do I! This sampling of tools is hand-carved from a linoleum block and printed in hand-mixed orange ink. Perfect for the handyman in your life, or Daddy’s little helper. The cards are printed on 100% cotton Crane Lettra paper. This paper, designed specifically for letterpress printing, is paired with matching Lettra envelopes. Blank interior. The image appears on a 5"x7" folded card, and is housed in an A7 (5 1/4"x 7 1/4") envelope. The paper offers a wonderfully textured and appealingly tactile surface for printing. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: How Lucky I Am (Purple)
description: There’s something wistful and sweet about Winnie the Pooh that generations of readers have loved; this quotation captures the quality perfectly. The imagined adventures shared by Christopher Robin with Pooh and his friends are poignant precisely because we know that one day the final moment in The House at Pooh Corner will arrive: he will depart for prep school and the rest of life, and the escapades in the Hundred Acre Wood will be over. Do you have someone in your live who makes you feel this lucky? Printed in handset Caslon and Jansen foundry type on 100% recycled paper. The sheet size is 8"x10" and is ready for framing. This is a limited edition print of 50 – your copy will be numbered and signed on the back. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: George R. R. Martin is Not Your Bitch
description: This limited edition letterpress poster is one of four prints commissioned by Cushing Memorial Library & Archives for Deeper than Swords, an exhibition celebrating the work of George R. R. Martin. The poster was was printed by hand on an antique printing press and used hand-mixed inks, hand-set wood and metal type. The 14X18 poster is printed on a sturdy cover stock made from 100% recycled content. This poster is part of a limited edition set of 60 prints; your copy will be numbered on the back. The poster is sold unframed and will ship in a clear protective sleeve and a sturdy cardboard tube. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

description: We designed this card to express feelings of jubilation! The bright colors, the field of stars (drawn and cut by hand from a relief block), and the irrepressible energy of the wood type combine to achieve a sense of shared celebration. We’re making this line of cards in various colors and with different captions, perfect for recognizing any notable moment or accomplishment. This card is printed on speckled off-white paper which is 100% recycled and environmentally friendly. Paired with cream Lettra envelopes. Available in either pale blue stars with vibrant red-orange lettering, or in cotton-candy pink stars with dark olive type. Blank interior, with the Anise Press logo on the reverse. This 4 ¼” x 5 ½” folded card is housed in an A2 (4 ½” x 5 ¾”) envelope. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: Love Is Home (unframed print)
description: Where we love is home. This simple line, taken from an Oliver Wendell Holmes poem, speaks volumes. This is the second print in our Home Series, highlighting quotations about the value of home by letterpress printing wood type compositions onto 100% cotton rag paper. This 8X10 print is perfect as a housewarming gift, to celebrate a couple or as a wedding present, or to provide color and sentiment to your own home. Printed using four wood typefaces onto Crane Lettra coverstock. This 100% cotton paper, specifically designed for letterpress printing, offers a wonderfully textured and appealingly tactile surface for printing. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the posters, and value their individuality.

name: Valentine's Card – You & Me
description: This card says it all in style – two pronouns in vintage wood type, with a wonderfully elaborate ampersand tying the two together. The first entry in our 2013 Valentine’s line offers a simple and beautiful expression of the essentials of a relationship, lovingly created by hand. This card is printed on environmentally affectionate 100% recycled paper, which we’ve paired with matching envelopes. The warm crimson and metallic gold inks are a fiery and intense match for the warm off-white paper. Blank interior, with the Anise Press logo on the reverse. The 4 ¼” x 5 ½” folded card is housed in an A2 (4 ½” x 5 ¾”) envelope. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality. (Copyright Anise Press 2013)

name: Closer to You card
description: This card is perfect for any relationship in which you’d like to propose getting just a bit closer. The antique zinc blocks, showing wood clamps of various designs, are interspersed with the direct (but polite) suggestion that you move a little nearer to each other. This card is printed on 100% cotton Crane Lettra paper. This paper, designed specifically for letterpress printing, provides a wonderfully tactile dimension to the print. The sepia ink of the vintage clamp illustrations is matched with the scarlet text of the handset Sapphire Titling type. Blank interior, with the Anise Press logo on the reverse. This 5” x 7” folded card is housed in a matching A7 (5 ¼” x 7 ¼”) envelope. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality. (Copyright Anise Press 2013)

name: Meow Is the Nicest Word
description: When a friend saw our recent “Home Is The Nicest Word” print, she was enthusiastic and decided to buy copies for her family – but then decided that it would be better to commission a slightly different version. Of course, cats are also extremely nice, and we were excited to create a spin on the earlier print for her. Since this poster was printed on neutral-toned paper, we decided to add some lounging felines to the design in a second color, so we created the silhouettes of cats in characteristic poses of laziness and superiority. This 12” x 16” poster was printed using four wood typefaces onto all-cotton paper. The blue poster's typography is accented by the orange images of posing cats, created by two original linoleum blocks. The alternate version, displaying brown typography, was created by overlaying blue ink onto orange, so a thin drop shadow of orange is still visible for a sophisticated effect. This is a limited edition print of 15, numbered on the back of the print. The poster is printed on 100% cotton Crane Lettra paper. This paper, designed specifically for letterpress printing, provides a wonderfully tactile dimension to the print. At 12” x 16”, the poster is suitable for framing in this standard size. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: Buttercups card
description: This image of wild buttercups was drawn and handcut from a linoblock, then printed on my 1896 Old Style Chandler & Price letterpress. Each card is printed in a deep navy ink. The cards are printed on Crane Lettra coverstock. This paper, designed specifically for letterpress printing, is paired with matching Lettra envelopes. Blank interior. The roughly 4”x 5 ½” image appears on a 5"x7" folded card, and is housed in an A7 (5 1/4"x 7 1/4") envelope. The luxurious tactile quality of the card gives the recipient pleasure of hand as well as of eye. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: Tea Party card
description: The domestic cheer offered by this gathering of three teapots would be appropriate as the invitation to a tea party, or simply as an everyday remembrance. The image was drawn and handcut from a linoblock, then printed individually on our 1896 Old Style Chandler & Price letterpress. A deep navy ink shows off the contours of the teapots with particular vigor. The cards are printed on Crane Lettra coverstock. This paper, designed specifically for letterpress printing, is paired with matching Lettra envelopes. Blank interior. The image appears on a 5"x7" folded card, and is housed in an A7 (5 1/4"x 7 1/4") envelope. The luxurious, tactile quality of the card gives the recipient pleasure of hand as well as of eye. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: The Crane Dance
description: This card, cut from a wood block by Scott Samuelson, depicts the birds’ annual courtship ritual, the crane dance. The 1909 Nobel Prize-winning writer Selma Lagerlöf describes the movements of the cranes, as “the big birds with their tall legs, their slender throats, their small heads, came gliding down the knoll with a mysterious abandon. They swung around – half flying, half dancing. . . . There was something marvelous and strange about that dance – as though gray shadows played a game too complex for eyes to follow.” The cards are printed on 100% cotton Crane Lettra paper. This paper, designed specifically for letterpress printing, is paired with matching Lettra envelopes. Blank interior. The image appears on a 5"x7" folded card, and is housed in an A7 (5 1/4"x 7 1/4") envelope. The paper offers a wonderfully textured and appealingly tactile surface for printing. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: Live Your Life
description: We’ve been thinking about beloved children’s book illustrator and author Maurice Sendak since his death in May and mulling over what we found to be a remarkable and poignant statement made in an interview he gave to NPR’s Fresh Air last September. In the interview, Sendak is quite sentimental and tender, and the advice he gives becomes a kind of valedictory statement for all he had experienced over eight decades: “Live your life. Live your life. Live your life.” Our design approach was to visually match the deepening power of the repeated phrase by printing the quotation in darkening warm hues. (Saying the words once is a platitude, and twice is advice, but three times is an incantation.) Thank you, Maurice Sendak, for everything. Printed in three colors on 100% recycled paper using hand-set wood type, these 14"x18" posters are ready for framing; we're sorry to say that despite the photo, we do not currently offer this poster already framed. This is a limited print run of 50 – your copy will be numbered and signed on the back. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the posters, and value their individuality.

name: How Lucky I Am (Yellow)
description: There’s something wistful and sweet about Winnie the Pooh that generations of readers have loved; this quotation captures the quality perfectly. The imagined adventures shared by Christopher Robin with Pooh and his friends are poignant precisely because we know that one day the final moment in The House at Pooh Corner will arrive: he will depart for prep school and the rest of life, and the escapades in the Hundred Acre Wood will be over. Do you have someone in your live who makes you feel this lucky? Printed in hand-set Caslon and Jansen foundry type on the luxuriously textured 100% cotton Crane Lettra. The size of the sheet is 7"x9". This is a limited edition print of 20 – your copy will be numbered and signed on the back. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.

name: Love Is All You Need
description: We couldn’t agree with John more: Love is all you need. Do you have a Beatles fan in your life? Or someone you’d like to join with in celebrating the power and persistence of love? This limited edition poster is printed on 100% recycled pale blue paper and is composed from hand-set wood type run through the press twice (once for the blue, and once for the metallic silver). This 14"x18" print is limited to a run of 50 – your copy will be numbered and signed on the back. Its standard size is easy to pair with a handsome frame. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the posters, and value their individuality.

name: Home is the Nicest (Vintage Wallpaper, Framed)
description: What is nice? Historical typography is nice. Floral-print wallpaper is nice. Reminders of the value of home are nice. This quotation is usually attributed to Laura Ingalls Wilder, but we don’t remember it from the books. We do remember that it was spoken by Laura in the first episode of the television series, and we think that Michael Landon’s Pa would approve this message and its mode of delivery. Printed using four wood typefaces onto vintage wallpaper samples to provide that homestyle feel. Because each sample is a different pattern, each print is unique. (Some of the wallpaper is relatively slick, and some has a fabric-like surface.) Please contact us for images of other prints in this series. Because the wallpaper is relatively limp, we offer the 11” x 14” print framed. Because of the nature of letterpress, slight variations in coloration and impression may be visible in the printing. We consider these marks of the process to be a testament to the handmade quality of the cards, and value their individuality.
